website_summaries.verdict: A popular brand known for quality speaker build and good acoustics. A particularly good choice for bass lovers.
pros: Straightforward installation thanks to easy-to-follow template
Delivers deep low-range acoustics that have been compared to theater sound
cons: High-range sounds are a bit lacking in clarity

customer_reviews.title: Still sounds good after 10 year.
customer_reviews.text: Still cranking out music and movies over the last 10 years. I have 5 of these mounted in ceiling as the surround speakers for a 7.1 system. They still sound great since I installed them in 2007.
customer_reviews.author: VJS

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive Speakers!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased six of these speakers (3 pairs) along with the Polk Audio 255C-RT center channel speaker to switch my surround sound set up from traditional floor/shelve speakers to in-ceiling. Bought these based on reading Amazon reviews and not wanting to pay at least twice as much for Bose. They speakers are fantastic, sound like a dream. Very easy to install once you plot out where to locate them. I had the advantage of an attic space above my great room to ensure there were no obstructions in my preferred locations, so I was able to do a self install project. Turned out beautifully! I HIGHLY recommend these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: The Rio Rancho Kid

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding in ceiling speakers!
customer_reviews.text: When our house was built, we had it pre-wired for ceiling speakers. We just didnt have the builder over charge us to install cheap speakers. I've owned Polk bookshelf speakers and I love the sound of them. Very crisp/clear highs. So I bought these w/o listening to them first. My assumptions were correct that Polk puts quality in all their speakers big and small. These were easy to install and they sound fantastic. Perfect highs and mids, and a decent amount of bass from a small speaker. Very happy with this purchase and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: High quality speakers for ambient music
customer_reviews.text: Installed these in the kitchen. They were well packaged, easy to install, and have durable construction. The aimable tweeter is a nice feature. These speakers can't replicate the sound quality of bookshelf speakers or freestanding monitors, but that's not really what these are for. Low end frequencies are missing, because it's not a subwoofer. It's great for in-home casual audio solutions. Listening to music in the kitchen, bathroom, or garage is a great use for these speakers. I would not suggest installing them in a home theater setup, you'll need to spend a lot more to get speakers up to that task.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Jonas

customer_reviews.title: Sounds worse than the Echo Dot
customer_reviews.text: I used Yamaha Rx-A880 to power it for Zone 2 to listen to music in the kitchen. It sounds muddy. I though something was wrong the receiver zone 2, so I connected it to the old Denon 3805 receiver. It still sounds terrible even with the help of the BSR-3000 graphic equalizer. It sounds worse than the Logitech Z130 computer speaker. I did not know this speaker came out over 10 years ago when I bought it. Don't buy this for ATMOS. The dispersion is weak, you have to be directly under the speaker. There is no way it meets the 45 degrees recommended by Dolby.
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: Product is confusing AND IT NOT RETURNABLE!
customer_reviews.text: This product is not returnable. So if you buy it - it is yours. Even unopened. So, 8" is not an 8 inch speaker, but a 8" driver with like a 10" speaker housing. I guess it wouldn't matter but I wanted to replace the speakers in an RV and I do not want to cut anything. :((
customer_reviews.author: Temper

customer_reviews.title: F#$^& klipsh/ get this you want be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of reading I decided to go for this polk ceiling speaker , I was a little skeptic because of the cheap price my whole system is klipsh i wanted to match the ceiling speakers as well but looking at those prices for just 1 ...hell no Long story short : I bought 2 for testing I end it up replacing my 5.2.4 atmos and whole house music system with this Total of 8
customer_reviews.author: agavila300blk

customer_reviews.title: Worth the hassle for atmos.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these in a 7.1.2 system powered by an Onkyo. They sound great and come with everything you need except the wire. Just make sure you wife isn't home when you cut the ceiling especially if you have blow in insulation and no way to get to it from the attic. the mess was,,,,,,,It was bad! Still totally worth it for Dolby Atmos theater sound. At least for me it was, She is still a little upset but were getting through it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken G.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound with some issues...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice sound quality. Two issues... one, when mounted in a ceiling, you MUST be standing under/between them to enjoy the sound. They should have had multiple tweeters to direct around a room. You can adjust the tweeters but in a ceiling install, that doesn’t work well. The second issue is that there is no backing. A LOT of the sound is sent upstairs and into the ceiling and you need to build a box with insulation to prevent that. Without some warning of this I’d consider that an incomplete product.
customer_reviews.author: DaGuru

customer_reviews.title: Listen before you buy. They’re cheap, and sound it.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing after all the positive reviews. I can only think many people haven’t heard a good ceiling speaker. I’m removing four of these and putting them on the front and back porch for background. They’re not really good enough for serious listening. They are cheap, so I guess OK for the money, but I ordered Klipsch 5800’s ( around $400 each). I think they’ll be more like what I expect for listening to music. I can’t recommend these. I had some fairly cheap JBL’s (8”) in my last house. They were in a different class from the Polks...clear and tight, where these are muddled and dull.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Northrop

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding speakers
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the manufacture date on these speakers fool you. Speaker technology hasn't changed very much in the last 10 to 15 years. Polk audio never disappoints. I installed these for my 7.2 Dolby Atmos set up and they sound great.
customer_reviews.author: J. LUGO

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound / Clean Look
customer_reviews.text: I didn't install myself but my installer had no issues. My sound is great. Major improvement to what I have before. Love the clean look in my ceilings and no longer having speakers hang out of my wall. I used them as rear speakers in my living room and then for speakers in my kitchen. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brayden Jessen

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: I installed two pairs of these speakers in my ceiling as front and surround for my home theater. Not only were they very easy to install, but they sound great. I can hear highs I didn’t hear with my previous speakers; and they actually fill the room with fuller sound. Heck, even my wife mentioned how good they sound. And she’s the first to complain when she’s watching tv programs or movies and can’t clearly hear what’s being said. With these installed that’s no longer the case. She’s very happy.
customer_reviews.author: wilfig12

customer_reviews.title: No-brainer purchase
customer_reviews.text: 20 second review: Great sounding, affordable speakers! Price is a steal. We put these in the ceiling of our kitchen and connected it to a Sonos Connect:Amp and it sounds awesome. I did a ton of research and these were by far the best combo of price and sound quality I could find! Two of these speakers easy fill a 25 x 15 room. By the way- it might just be me, but make sure to look at the measurement of the speakers, these were much bigger than the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended.
customer_reviews.text: Short and to the point, this product works as intended. I had no issues with it. Great sound, easy installation. No reason to have wall mount speakers unless you have a legit theater. No your basement doesnt count as a theater, a theater is a room dedicated to wasting money on speakers, projectors and seating.
customer_reviews.author: Maxter50

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable home speakers
customer_reviews.text: These work great! The installation is easy. Sound quality is great. We bought them for watching movies and playing music in our living room and on our covered outdoor porch. We've had no issues with them playing audio outside under a covered porch. I've only experienced an issue of the cover popping off once when I had music with heavy bass blaring. Other than that, these work great. Great buy for the price. We have since moved and we want to put speakers into our media/play room and are hoping to buy these exact ones again.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Great value for sound quality! Intermediate installation
customer_reviews.text: If you consider yourself an audiophile these are an overall great value. They provide excellent highs, midrange, and are great for listening to easy going music, news, and sports broadcast on TV. For lows and bass, these speakers will be perfect when accompanied with a powered subwoofer. Any under $200 should work. Installation can be done by a weekend warrior who has the right tools for cutting sheet rock or in my application, hardy. For a clean installation, one must be competent in running wire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound
customer_reviews.text: Placed 4 of these in the ceiling of my new outdoor patio. The ceiling was insulated; which may add the improvement in sound quality. Easy template to cut. Will be spray painting the trim and covers soon. I am powering them with the new Sonos Amp. They are quite sensitive (rarely turned up more than 1/4 volume) and I am very impressed with the sound quality and bass they are producing. I don't think you'd get much better spending far more.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Meshberger

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I paired four of these in my kitchen to a single Sonos connect Amp. When wired in parallel these 8ohm speakers work fantastic but baware that when configured this way it drops impedance down to 4ohms at the amp. Verify that your amp can handle this before install. 8” drivers produce enough low end that you don’t “need” a sub. Lots of range and I personally love them for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Austin M.

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor Speakers
customer_reviews.text: We were replacing some box wall mounted speakers that the birds had taken over with these that go into the ceiling. Since we already had our wiring these were so easy to install and my husband was so proud of himself! Birds left and it is a good thing all around for our patio time!
customer_reviews.author: T Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I really like these speakers. I installed them in the ceiling of my outdoor patio. They sound great. Decent amount of bass. I run them off of Russ Sound amplifier. Install was pretty straight forward. Comes with a nice template for the hole to cut. They look real nice, you hardly notice they are there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers
customer_reviews.text: These fill in very nicely as surround speakers in a place where traditional surrounds are out of the questions. I have enjoyed listening to them so far. Make sure you are receiver has the capacity to push out enough power to the speaker so that you enjoy the full potential. Great price great product
customer_reviews.author: NGUVU

customer_reviews.title: They sound fantastic and can deal with all kinds of muisc
customer_reviews.text: I've had these playing for a year now mounted in the ceiling. They sound fantastic and can deal with all kinds of muisc. The highs are clear and smooth while they offer deep bass for electronica and dance music. I will get another pair for my bedroom soon. And after three years they are still going playing our music all day and night. Paired them with a 10" Polk subwoofer to complete the picture of pure sonic bliss from Mozart to Metal.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Dysthe

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of ceiling speakers.
customer_reviews.text: They have a nice outside look and seem to be built with great quality. I tested those and worked fine, it’s hard to make a review putting them to work as theyy are intended. But so far the initial test they have enough power for a small room. They are a bit heavy for sheet rock, I am going to use the (plastic) brackets, but keep in mind that those are $50 bucks a pair!! And also have to be the same brand, tried a different manufacturer and there was no way they would work, even when they were advertised for 8” speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Mayito

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product and sound.
customer_reviews.text: After much research, I bought these two replace existing speakers outside, under my porch. The speakers are very high quality and have clear, strong, great sound. The install was very easy and clear to understand. We painted them to match the ceiling and they look really nice.
customer_reviews.author: ClovesJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install, Sound Great
customer_reviews.text: These speakers install easily and quickly. Bought 3 pair and installed in ceiling in various rooms for a whole house distribution system (hooked to speaker selector which is fed by zone 2 of my surround sound system). Very happy with the sound. Do not really drive volume up high. Keep them low to medium volume. Work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality for ambient music
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers for ambiance music in the kitchen/living area of my house. They provide clear sound, and appear to be better than cheap paper cone speakers. I don't intend to turn them up very loud, but testing them yielded clear results at moderately high volumes (louder than music for a typical social gathering, but not so loud that the neighbors could hear). I did not box them in, just cut the holes and put them up there. 100w amp pushing them. I'd recommend them for a similar purpose, and probably for rear channels in a theater setup.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: What's that sound above me? Oh, it's Dolby Atmos.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair for my new Dolby Atmos installation. No problem installing, but one of the grills didn't want to attach well, and the first time I turned the volume loud, the grill fell down. Polk was nice enough to send me a replacement grill. The sound is just fine, and I'm enjoying my Dolby Atmos system
customer_reviews.author: SoCal guy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound - running from a Yamaha amp
customer_reviews.text: WOW, suprised as heck over the sound. With 4 in the pool room its usually crystal clear. Probably not your main driver set, but awesome constant background sound. Clear, crisp. I will be adding a base unit as the amp has that output and I think these might rival my high end stuff. More than impressed, thanks Polk
customer_reviews.author: Ed Q

customer_reviews.title: Mildly disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I think the RC85i is a better choice. Fuller sound for a few bucks more. I've got both. The RC85i's fill up a huge room dynamic sound. These RC80i are a little lacking... can't quite fill up a much smaller room. YMMV. I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan L.

customer_reviews.title: NO RETURNS, CONSIDERED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PER AMAZON.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and tested these in my system before installing. I was not happy with the sound, or lack thereof and Amazon won't accept the return because they are considered hazardous materials
customer_reviews.author: Jon Snow

customer_reviews.title: Too good for my smaller room
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. I bought them for the rear speakers on my home theater renovation. It is a bit of a smaller room and these will knock me out of the room if I let them...
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Must have speakers for your covered outdoor space!
customer_reviews.text: Finally hooked them up on my large covered patio and they sound awesome. Currently have 4 installed, when done there will be six in a 900 sqft space. I have them paired with a Technical Pro 6000w which easily handles 6 pairs of speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for a single speaker system
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install with included template for marking ceiling or wall. Quality is about what you would expect for the price - good enough for most people, and perhaps quite good for a single speaker system (without sub-woofer or tweeters).
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Prince

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, nicely discreet
customer_reviews.text: The speakers sound absolutely great. Installation was easy, however the locking mechanism does NOT clamp thinner fibreboard - I had to put in a spacer to get a firm fit. Unfortunately on the Polka website I could NOT register this product outside of USA/Canada/Mexico - I ordered from New Zealand.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Very sleek!
customer_reviews.text: Used these to replace an older set and they work great! Sound is crisp and they look very neat in the ceiling! In the images attached-you’ll see them in the ceiling but they look nice.
customer_reviews.author: jerseyjazz

customer_reviews.title: Medium sound quality
customer_reviews.text: They were quick and easy to install. However, the sound quality is mediocre at best and we used premium speaker wire. Luckily, it is mostly for NPR so the sound quality is not too much of an issue. I would suggest a higher level if you want it for premium sound
customer_reviews.author: Mason Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Great rear surrounds
customer_reviews.text: I'm very picky when it comes to my audio ,I'm using these speakers as my rear surrounds in a 5.1 system and for the price you can not go wrong ,just pick them up I'm sure you will be satisfied,they are mounted 2 feet behind me and I hear everything,let's face it ,not many of us can put speakers on stands behind us ,these work perfecttttt
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Devivo

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers just a little confusing on the tightening
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these to put in my ceiling. Good quality and pretty straight forward install. The confusing thing at the beggining was the tightening of the brackets to get the speaker to hold. Once I figured that out the second installation was a lot quicker.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: NON - Returnable Item... Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: This item is Non returnable for any reason. If your product comes damaged or you don't like it you are stuck with it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Polk Audio - Quality Engineering and Sonic Excellence !!
customer_reviews.text: These Polk Audio RC80i speakers are the perfect addition to my Polk Audio CS10 center channel and Polk Audio PSW505 Sub Woofer. The sound quality of these speakers is AWESOME. The Sub produces crisp, rib shaking bass. The Center and the Ceiling Speakers produce crystal clear highs, solid mids and seamless bass that is complemented by the hard punching Sub. I highly recommend these Polk Audio Speakers. Size does matter and these 8 inch 2 way speakers will surely not disappoint. My only regret, I didn't buy these sooner......
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Polk audio always makes a great product for the price. Installed these in my family room and they sound perfect for surround speakers.
customer_reviews.author: John Cokkinias

customer_reviews.title: Sound great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our home theatre system. Using them for the rear left & right speakers. Had a handyman install them in the ceiling. They look great and sound even better!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased! Excellent build quality and excellent sound!
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the speaker cable to them, the speaker install is pretty easy. I used a Dremel to cut the hole (use a wet-dry vac to suction while you cut) for the template. Go a little bigger than the template, if you ask me, that way the speaker will go in the first time. Grinding off 1/8" extra drywall is a mess you don't want. Once the speakers are in and covered, they really do disappear, except when the stereo is playing. That's when they make their presence known. These speakers clamp down on the drywall just like the wall speakers do, so aside from the speaker hole, they don't do anything to your drywall. It's a clever system.
customer_reviews.author: Catbug!

customer_reviews.title: Great for the bathroom
customer_reviews.text: Installed these in the master bathroom. Sound great. Powered by a 20amp mini amplifier. Sturdy and well-made. Cover and ring look nice on the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Smith

customer_reviews.title: These turned out great. I've got an in wall volume control between ...
customer_reviews.text: These turned out great. I've got an in wall volume control between the speakers and my receiver, and everything installed smoothly. These were easy to mount and sound pretty good. They are by no means audiophile grade sound, but for allowing me to have music while we sit outside, or when I'm cooking on the grill, they do absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t got a chance to really let them loose. I use them as my Dolby Atmos speakers in my basement. They sound great. However I only have it an overall 4 star because the backs of them were larger than I anticipated. I had to navigate ducts and stuffs what not in my basement, so it was a tad annoying. But overall great speaker so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, great sound for outdoor speakers
customer_reviews.text: I installed the speakers outdoor in my patio ceiling. Easy to install. Sound great. I'm buying some Polk Audio Bookshelf Speakers as a result of my experience with these Polk ceiling speakers!
customer_reviews.author: SKE

customer_reviews.title: Speakers sound great!
customer_reviews.text: Speakers sound great. Don’t over tighten the screw though, just tighten enough to secure speaker to ceiling. I over tightened one speaker of four, and it broke the drywall ceiling slightly ( not flat anymore) so I had to sparkle and feather the ceiling to make it look smooth again
customer_reviews.author: ejohnson3012000

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers, Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound great, especially for the price. They went up fairly easily without hassle. I am using them as a zone 2 for my home theater receiver as speakers for my echo. I was worried about the balance of sound on these, but the bass sounds very good and radiates out. The mids and highs sounds very good too. I am primarily using these as background music and they easily fill up my open floorpan.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Lou

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic speaker for incredible price
customer_reviews.text: Since I didn't have any Room in my living Room for rear speakers I decided to install ceiling speakers between my living Room and kitchen. These provides a little bit extra rear fill fantastic for watching movies
customer_reviews.author: Anthony P.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!  Look great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers to add inciting speakers to my 7.2 surround system in my home theater. I have always been a fan of polk audio and these speakers did not disappoint. I believe these speakers have great sound (high and low) and whats nice is that you can direct the tweeters in any direction. This was extremely helpful in the setup of my theater. Very easy to install into drywall!
customer_reviews.author: Jdacla

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: The speakers are good, they sound good and the installation is relatively easy, it does has one bug, we put them and then we wanted to correct the orientation for the sound, removing the grill was a pain in the ... there is no easy way to pull it of because there is no way to grab it, of course this is what makes them look neat installed so it's good and bad. In the end we are happy with them, just check if you like the orientation of the sound before putting the final touch (the grill) and you will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: dri

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a kitchen remodel to be used with a 55" TV and amp. They sound great and my wife loves being able to listen to great sounding TV while she cooks. Will buy again for other areas where we will be doing re-models.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your money
customer_reviews.text: Installed these on my new home in the kitchen, makes cooking more enjoyable now. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the sound. Yes I know they are ceiling speakers, but they sound great. Definitely notice the difference once they break in! I use a Sonos Connect and power the speakers with an Audio Source AMP100VS 2 channel amp, which also powers my patio speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Melgar

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and quality for a fairly inexpensive speaker set.
customer_reviews.text: Used these as the back 2 speakers in the ceiling for a 7.1 surround sound setup. Very easy to install, although a bit nerve-racking to cut such a big hole in the wall! They sound great!
customer_reviews.author: bptexas

customer_reviews.title: Great sound with good bass and the adjustable tweeter very important.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound with the 8” speaker and adjustable tweet. Just cut the hole using the template (checking to ensure the area is clear, of course), connect the speaker wire and install.
customer_reviews.author: John C!

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted in my ceiling very easily. In general they are pretty loud, but they lack much mid-low to low sound. Overall I am happy. You should plan on pairing these with a good center channel / subwoofer for high quality surround sound.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of these as part of my whole home audio setup. They sound great and I am extremely happy with them. My complaint is that the covers are a complete pain. I was very careful in putting the covers back on after installing the speakers, but I still managed to slightly bend 2 of the 4 covers that I put on. It's not a huge deal, and nobody probably notices except for me, but I see these small dents in them every time I walk in and look at them. Just be careful, it's extremely thin metal and very easy to dent.
customer_reviews.author: C. Baker

customer_reviews.title: ) These sound great and look great in my ceiling
customer_reviews.text: I wrote an earlier review about a small and inexpensive receiver I purchased to fit within a space. These Polk in-Ceiling speakers made that little receiver rock... without these I would have not had what I wanted... :) These sound great and look great in my ceiling...
customer_reviews.author: Janell Cedarstrom-Wysocki

customer_reviews.title: Great sound & reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Put in 7 speakers. 1 center channel & pointed the tweeter forward. It really sounds good! They are better than I expected. Recommend for any home.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Was a Great Order
customer_reviews.text: This item is a Great thing that I wanted and am Glad that I ordered this item!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth J. Frey

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and big!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, but make sure you realize how big they are! If used in uninsulated ceilings or walls they tend to transfer alot of sound to the surrounding rooms, so either plan for that or throw some insulation behind the speakers (this is true for all wall/ceiling mounted speakers though
customer_reviews.author: unhpian

customer_reviews.title: sound quality
customer_reviews.text: i installed these out doors in the eves of the porch. They look good, easy to install and have great sound
customer_reviews.author: ben muller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speakers for any application and once paired with a nice subwoofer they sound INCREDIBLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two sets of these speakers for a total of four. They sound amazing, and I love that you can point the center tweeter towards the listening position of your choice. Not difficult to install if you're handy with tools. I live in a small house so being limited on space these worked out amazing. I went on a music/movie/game binge for the entire weekend after installing these.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Jones

customer_reviews.title: I'm a bit disappointed at the sound
customer_reviews.text: the actual drivers themselves are measured to be only 6" but requires cutting a hole over 9" in diameter. Labeling them with an 8 in the product name, therefore, is kind of a lie. I'm a bit disappointed at the sound fidelity. It's just so meh. i have to keep my floor speakers out because these ceiling ones don't have enough range.
customer_reviews.author: Joe K*

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive ceiling-mount speakers. Will last forever, first pair is 15+ years old and still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair of RC80i speakers 15 years ago for surround sound side speakers in a dedicated media room. Recently, I purchased three more sets to install as "whole home audio" background music speakers, and they sound great. Best value for real 8-inch two-way speakers with good rubber surrounds. The 15 year old speakers still look and sound new.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W

customer_reviews.title: The sound is amazing! Super clear mids and highs
customer_reviews.text: After reading every review about these speakers I was slightly hesitant to order. After getting and installing them I am truly blown away! The sound is amazing! Super clear mids and highs! Bass is okay, but I don't need bass from these,my subwoofer handles that. Only regret I have is reading all of the reviews and not ordering these sooner. I will buy these again and again. Overall amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: Packs a punch for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Sounds amazing. I went from Jamo speakers to these due to trying to save a little on my overall budget. I was honestly surprised how wall they sounded. I paired these with the A6 center channel and the 265RT in wall fronts.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: These are great in-ceiling speakers!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new home that had 4 sets of in-ceiling speakers. They were 10 year old inexpensive intercom speakers that didn't sound very good musically. I bought these without hearing them first so a bit of a gamble. Replaced them all with these Polk 8" and I am very happy with them. They are high quality constructed and they sound great. I was also impressed with the packaging. I would recommend these to anyone who is shopping for in-ceiling speakers near this price range. Swapping them out was a simple job for me as they went right in the existing cutouts.
customer_reviews.author: CAL

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my money because I believed in my son
customer_reviews.text: My son was going to install them but never did, know anyone that could use them

product_meta.title: Polk Audio RC80i 2-way Premium In-Ceiling 8" Round Speakers, Set of 2 Perfect for Damp and Humid Indoor/Outdoor Placement - Bath, Kitchen, Covered Porches (White, Paintable Grille)
product_meta.description:
Size:RC80i, 8 Inch| Style:Set of 2RCi Series In-Wall Speakers deliver incredible Polk sound to every room in your home without using any floor or shelf space! Now you have new options for more flexibility and performance from Polk Audio. Out of the box and into the wall (or ceiling), that’s how easy it is to install new Polk Audio RCi Series In-ceiling Loudspeakers like the RC80i. Dynamic Balance drivers and aimable tweeters ensure spacious imaging with amazing clarity as well as a well-balanced sound in any listening position, not just a small "sweet spot." Paint them to match your decor and they practically disappear, leaving you with nothing but high-performance sound! Installation is easy as 1-2-3: cut one hole, feed the wires, and simply drop the speaker in. Rotating Cams secure the speaker safely with no extra assembly or mess. Klippel motor optimization uses laser measurement technology to ensure a smooth excursion path at either end of the volume spectrum for uniform performance at both low and high volumes.

AMAZON.COM


The Polk Audio RC80i 2-way In-ceiling Speaker delivers incredible stereo sound to any room in your home from speakers you can barely see, without using any floor or shelf space. The RC80i is easy to install, requiring only that you cut a hole, feed the wires through, and simply drop the speaker in where it is held in place by rotating cams that safely secure the speaker with no extra assembly or mess. Once installed, the paintable grille and flange allows this in-ceiling speaker to virtually disappear in the room.

Polk Audio RC80i in-ceiling speakers in white. The Polk RC80i utilizes a eight-inch dynamic-balance, mineral filled polymer-composite cone with a rubber surround that outlasts cheaper foam surrounds, as well as a one-inch ring-radiator tweeter with a 15-degree swivel mount. The swivel-mounted tweeter is aimable for direct high frequency control that ensures spacious imaging with amazing clarity, and well-balanced sound in any listening position, even off-axis listening positions, rather than in just a small sweet spot. 

Constructed of rust resistant hardware and durable, moisture resistant materials, the RC80i is safe for use in bathrooms, kitchens, saunas, or even under outdoor eaves, and a glass-filled composite baffle that provides a dense, acoustically inert platform for the speaker's high end components. This unit features strong composite driver baskets that keep moving parts in rigid alignment, a wide-dispersion design for even sound-coverage throughout even large rooms, and a wall-distance toggle switch that flattens frequency response when installation requires placement near a corner or adjacent wall. The RC80i also features a tweeter-level switch that lets you tailor the highs for your room acoustics, and is timbre-matched to the Polk Audio Monitor Series for seamless, enveloping imaging when used in a home theater system.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
RC80i speakers (pair), 2 grilles, 2 cardboard templates with paint masks, owner's manual, and registration card. 



FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The RC80i features a beefy 8-inch woofer to produce the maximum amount of bass and a one inch dome tweeter for depth and detail, resulting in rich lifelike sound from an in-ceiling speaker—performance unheard of just a few years ago. An ideal solution for areas requiring big, room-filing sound without the big speaker cluttering up your room, The RC80i's wide dispersion capability means you'll hear great sound no matter where you are in the room.

key features

 * Paintable grilles allow you to make your speakers disappear completely into your painted walls (but you can always leave them white too).
 * Out of the box into the ceiling installation. The RC80i uses rugged stainless steel hardware and powder-coated aluminum grille for years of dependable performance. (Please note that RCi Series loudspeakers are not suitable for exposed outdoor use. For outdoor applications, use our Atrium Series speakers).
 *  Swivel tweeter. The RC80i features a swiveling tweeter so you can aim it toward the listening area for greater accuracy.

take a look inside this product 



technology 

Dynamic Balance® and Klippel Optimization Like all Polk speakers, the transducers in the RC80i speakers are products of Dynamic Balance technology and Klippel Optimization. A Dynamic Balance tweeter or driver has been designed using microscopic testing, materials science, and precision-designed interfaces to reduce or eliminate mechanical breakup that adds distortion and colors the sound. Klippel Optimization ensures the speaker will perform well at both low and high volumes levels.

Blue Polymer Woofers with Rubber Surround Provide excellent damping and bass response while resisting deterioration. Your RCi speakers should last longer than your house. Other speakers use flimsy paper cones and foam surrounds that fall apart due to time and exposure.

Timbre Matched The RC80i, like all RCi series speakers, is timbre matched to our freestanding speakers - such as Polk Monitor, TSi and OWM series, just in case you need in-ceiling surround speakers to match your freestanding fronts.

why you should consider this product

If you're looking to fill a room or your home with life-like sound, you should seriously consider the RC80i for its high performance audio, ease of installation, and amazing value. Use RC80i's all around your home where you care about good sound or as rear channel surround speakers in your home theater system.

They really blend in and are easy to install....but you need to be mindful. When cutting the hole you must keep your drywall knife on the line and never go inside the line as this will make it more difficult to insert the speaker. You will have to shave the area you went inside and that crumbles the drywall a bit. Now....when tightening the speaker to your ceiling I highly recommend doind it manually. When you start tightening there will be some tension because the clamps are turning outward and rubbing the post. Then you will feel almost no tension when tightening. As soon as you feel tension, you know you have reached the drywall and you should only turn the screwdriver one and have more times. AMAZON.COM


The Polk Audio RC80i 2-way In-ceiling Speaker delivers incredible stereo sound to any room in your home from speakers you can barely see, without using any floor or shelf space. The RC80i is easy to install, requiring only that you cut a hole, feed the wires through, and simply drop the speaker in where it is held in place by rotating cams that safely secure the speaker with no extra assembly or mess. Once installed, the paintable grille and flange allows this in-ceiling speaker to virtually disappear in the room.

Polk Audio RC80i in-ceiling speakers in white. The Polk RC80i utilizes a eight-inch dynamic-balance, mineral filled polymer-composite cone with a rubber surround that outlasts cheaper foam surrounds, as well as a one-inch ring-radiator tweeter with a 15-degree swivel mount. The swivel-mounted tweeter is aimable for direct high frequency control that ensures spacious imaging with amazing clarity, and well-balanced sound in any listening position, even off-axis listening positions, rather than in just a small sweet spot. 

Constructed of rust resistant hardware and durable, moisture resistant materials, the RC80i is safe for use in bathrooms, kitchens, saunas, or even under outdoor eaves, and a glass-filled composite baffle that provides a dense, acoustically inert platform for the speaker's high end components. This unit features strong composite driver baskets that keep moving parts in rigid alignment, a wide-dispersion design for even sound-coverage throughout even large rooms, and a wall-distance toggle switch that flattens frequency response when installation requires placement near a corner or adjacent wall. The RC80i also features a tweeter-level switch that lets you tailor the highs for your room acoustics, and is timbre-matched to the Polk Audio Monitor Series for seamless, enveloping imaging when used in a home theater system.
